Package com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models

Class ContainerACL.AccessPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models.ContainerACL.AccessPolicy
  • Enclosing class:
    ContainerACL

    public static class ContainerACL.AccessPolicy
extends java.lang.Object
    An inner class representing the start time, expiration time, and permissions associated with an access policy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccessPolicy

        public AccessPolicy​()

    • Method Detail

      • getStart

        public java.util.Date getStart​()
        Gets the start time for valid access to a resource using the access policy. If this value is null, the start time for any resource request using the access policy is assumed to be the time when the Blob service receives the request.
        Returns:
        A Date representing the start time for the access policy, or null if none is specified.

      • setStart

        public ContainerACL.AccessPolicy setStart​(java.util.Date start)
        Sets the start time for valid access to a resource using the access policy. If this value is null, the start time for any resource request using the access policy is assumed to be the time when the Blob service receives the request.
        Parameters:
        start - A Date representing the start time for the access policy, or null to leave the time unspecified.
        Returns:
        A reference to this ContainerACL.AccessPolicy instance.

      • getExpiry

        public java.util.Date getExpiry​()
        Gets the expiration time for valid access to a resource using the access policy. If this value is null, any Shared Access Signature that refers to this access policy must specify the expiry value.
        Returns:
        A Date representing the expiration time for the access policy, or null if none is specified.

      • setExpiry

        public ContainerACL.AccessPolicy setExpiry​(java.util.Date expiry)
        Sets the expiration time for valid access to a resource using the access policy. If this value is null, any Shared Access Signature that refers to this access policy must specify the expiry value.
        Parameters:
        expiry - A Date representing the expiration time for the access policy, or null to leave the time unspecified.
        Returns:
        A reference to this ContainerACL.AccessPolicy instance.

      • getPermission

        public java.lang.String getPermission​()
        Gets the permissions for operations on resources specified by the access policy. Supported permissions include read (r), write (w), delete (d), and list (l). Permissions may be grouped so as to allow multiple operations to be performed with the access policy. For example, if all permissions to a resource are granted, the method returns "rwdl" as the result. If only read/write permissions are granted, the method returns "rw" as the result.
        Returns:
        A String containing the permissions specified for the access policy.

      • setPermission

        public ContainerACL.AccessPolicy setPermission​(java.lang.String permission)
        Sets the permissions for operations on resources specified by the access policy. Supported permissions include read (r), write (w), delete (d), and list (l). Permissions may be grouped so as to allow multiple operations to be performed with the access policy. For example, to grant all permissions to a resource, specify "rwdl" for the parameter. To grant only read/write permissions, specify "rw" for the parameter.
        Parameters:
        permission - A String containing the permissions specified for the access policy.
        Returns:
        A reference to this ContainerACL.AccessPolicy instance.
